Nebby Neighbor

(In Pittsburgh, "nebby" means "nosy")

Place all neighbors so that no one is hidden from someone's view. To fit everyone, you'll need 2 neighbors in each row and each column.

8
6x6-042

By Will Penman. See some interesting facts about this game.

Mathematically, this game is the "no three in line" problem. Computers have found all the possible puzzle solutions up through 18×18 grids. The biggest solution ever found is from a 52×52 grid, where the computer was able to place the full 104 neighbors. Nobody knows if it's possible to do it on every grid size.
